content: Chris Orlob Fantastic article! Is it possible to remove men from this data and run the the same analysis on of purely female sellers? If the data consists of purely female sellers yet the correlation between poor sales performance and monologuing(along with other “sales sins”) still exists then we have confirmed these behaviors are harmful regardless of gender. Otherwise you could attribute women performing better to a variety of gender-specific reasons such as the fact that most people’s default trust level is higher for females then males. Or, that the most buyers are male, and male social proclivities differ when interacting with females versus other males.
